questions.question: I wish I ............................ run faster.
questions.description: When 'wish' is used to talk about unreal or impossible situations, we use a past tense to refer to the present.

questions.question: I wish you ............................. stay out of this.
questions.description: When 'wish' is used to talk about unreal or impossible situations, we use a past tense to refer to the present.

questions.question: I wish you ........................ keep the volume down.
questions.description: To express regret that things are not different, we use a past tense with wish.

questions.question: I wish I ............................... that offer.
questions.description: Past perfect tenses are used to talk about wishes about the past.

questions.question: I wish I ........................... better looking.
questions.description: Was and were are both possible when we talk about unreal situations and conditions.

questions.question: I wish I ......................... take a holiday.
Don't you wish you ........................... fly?
questions.description: After wish, we use could to talk about wishes that we cannot realize.

questions.question: Do you wish .......................... drinks on the terrace?
questions.description: After wish, we can use an object + to-infinitive.

questions.question: I ........................... an appointment with the manager.
questions.description: Wish + direct object is not normally possible without a following infinitive.

questions.question: I .......................... you feel better tomorrow.
questions.description: Wish + that-clause is not generally used for wishes about things that seem possible in the future.

questions.question: Now I wish I ................................ to university.
questions.description: Past perfect tenses are used for wishes about the past.
